articles.title: From Solar Flares to Sahara Skies: RHESSI's Fiery Return to Earth - SciTechDaily
articles.description: NASA’s retired Reuven Ramaty High Energy Solar Spectroscopic Imager (RHESSI) spacecraft re-entered Earth’s atmosphere at 8:21 p.m. EDT on Wednesday, April 19, almost 21 years after its launch. From 2002 to its decommissioning in 2018, RHESSI observed solar fl…
articles.content:
ByNASAApril 22, 2023
NASAs RHESSI spacecraft re-entered Earths atmosphere after nearly 21 years, during which it observed solar flares and provided crucial data on their underlying physics. The data… [+7379 chars]
